review_title: Not a Safe Place for People of Color
pros:
-Students are great
-Some silos/departments have good coworkers
cons:
-HR found in a 2017-2018 work study audit that the University was hiring white student workers at 3 times the rate of students of color. In addition, many of those white students did not go through the official job application process as federally required.
-The Religion Department and Professors in said department  continue to push a narrative of White supremacy. Multiple faculty & staff have documented written proof of Professors vilifying acts of social justice on campus including: peaceful protest, "The New Jim Crow", & support of Charlottesville. Religion Professors have also been known to slander Democratic figures in class finals, and some Religion Faculty are even concealed gun carriers. 
-The cabinet of the university is only white, and has been so since the inception of the University. They cut employee benefits cut in 2017, and continued to receive egregious salaries. 
-The only representative group of colored employees in a department can be found in Housing and in Custodial. Custodial workers also have a high turnover rate for obvious implications.

pros: Students are fun. Facilities with the new library, are top notch. Library staff = fantastic. Campus being so small is a lot of fun.

The entitlement of many of these senior managers leads to the most unprofessional emotional outbursts in meetings that I've encountered in my 25 year career to date. Also, senior managers often have "pets" who can "do no wrong" even when the pet screws up constantly. So Concordia Portland also sets records for employing the most incompetent people I've ever seen not fired in my career.

review_title: College Of Education Is Deeply Flawed
pros: > Mints in the waiting room.
cons:
> Bunch of white folks (maybe like me) sympathizing with minorities and hell-bent on social equity issues they will never understand.
> No minority leadership for minority issues. (hypocritical and ironic)
>Worst pay ever. I have two advanced degrees and my pay ended up to be around minimum wage.
> No one can ever say anything bad about the College Of Education website because the director created it (it's terrible unless you are familiar with all the programs).
> They just nixed the LGBTQ student union/club. How's that for social equity? Religion ruins everything.
> Google "Hot Chalk and Concordia". They ran a "partnership" together that's now under federal investigation. They're trying to be the University of Phoenix for teacher education. Hot Chalk is a shady marketing company. 
> Education Fire Sale: There are few teaching jobs in Oregon and new students don't realize this after the sales spiel. 
> PSU just got a $100M cash injection from the state and donors to beef up the medical end education departments. Edu programs from other universities are toast so forget this school.  The best EdTech, curriculum, and professors will not be here if the money is well spent.
